text: Tbh dating a coworker is not something that unheard of, seems it happens often

Orthodox Christianity makes great use of metanoias/prostrations (where one makes the sign of the cross then gets on knees and touches his forehead to the floor, saying the Jesus prayer), St. Ephraim of Arizona and Fr. Rose both gave it as a daily rule to their spiritual students.

Galkovsky says the best way to spot spies, police informants, moles, etc. in Soviet academic environment was looking for unremarkable people. Students obsessed with an autistic absolute fixation like reconstructing a lost Indo-European language are never spies, it can't be faked.

Women were also not chosen - too simple, too "hormonal", easily attached. Sons of politicians, policemen, party members, etc. are paradoxically trustworthy. No one is dumb enough to hire them as informants. Silent "rural" types, with lower grades, etc. - there is the real danger.

People who are easily impressed by titles and positions, those who crave the company of women. Ideological ones are too open. Those who do it for malice and not for money are more dangerous, for them "snitching" takes a sexual nature. The worst of all: homosexuals and pedophiles.

"A peasant's shirt (a "Tolstoy shirt") symbolizes societal irresponsibility." - Galkovsky

An author who poses as a hayseed hick is like a surgeon who botches an operation and then hides under the table and starts mumbling "I am a simple Christian, a little man from the people.."

The thing Galkovsky hates the most is pseudo-peasants. Literature writers, philosophers, and intellectuals who pose as "simple rural folksy people from the backwoods" to avoid the responsibility of their position and deflect critique. Gorky is a disgusting example. Hemingway too.

"Write a bad book - you get "criticism" and a laborer-peasant origin has nothing to do with it." The fundamental worldview of pseudo-peasantry per Galkovsky is: "Just be kind." ("just be muhfuggin normal"). This is actually the main distinguishing trait of such an "intellectual".
They used to make fun of Galkovsky because his head was way too big for his body, a giant cranium balancing on top of a thin neck. Dr. Ray Peat right again.

He says his most smart family member was his paternal grandmother who was almost illiterate and gives her having a lot of children as a proof for her intelligence. To him fertility and intelligence are always related.
I can be bombastic on occasion
Observation: Gottfried Leibniz's "System of Pre-established Harmony" sounds like the name of an obscure Salvador Dali painting.

Per Galkovsky, the typical racial minority thief hates the police imperfectly, because he always has his little doubts, "maybe they beat me for reason, I did a bad thing..." But the intellectual hates the communist secret police with a pure hatred that comes from his superiority.

The intellectual knows he is superior to the communist censors, more intelligent, more talented, sharper, etc. As with critiques of Nietzsche, the vicious are tempted to mockingly ask: If he is so superior why is he not above them? But that's the beautiful thing. Galkovsky won.
